Classify occurrence records in levels of confidence in species determination

classify_occ.Rd

Classifies occurrence records in levels of confidence in species determination

classify_occ(
  occ,
  spec = NULL,
  na.rm.coords = TRUE,
  crit.levels = c("det_by_spec", "taxonomist", "image", "sci_colection", "field_obs",
    "no_criteria_met"),
  ignore.det.names = NULL,
  spec.ambiguity = "not.spec",
  institution.source = "institutionCode",
  collection.code = "collectionCode",
  catalog.number = "catalogNumber",
  year.event = "year",
  date.identified = "dateIdentified",
  scientific.name = "species",
  determined.by = "identifiedBy",
  longitude = "decimalLongitude",
  latitude = "decimalLatitude",
  basis.of.rec = "basisOfRecord",
  media.type = "mediaType",
  occ.id = "occurrenceID"
)

Arguments

occ

Data frame with occurrence records information.
spec

Data frame with specialists' names. See details.
na.rm.coords

Logical. If TRUE, remove occurrences with NA in latitude or longitude
crit.levels

Character. Vector with levels of confidence in decreasing order. The criteria allowed are det_by_spec, taxonomist, image, sci_colection, field_obs, no_criteria_met. See details.
ignore.det.names

character vector indicatiing strings in the determined.by columns that should be ignored as a taxonomist. See details.
spec.ambiguity

character. Indicates how to deal with ambiguity in specialists names. not.spec solve ambiguity by classifing the determinating as done by a non-specialist;is.spec assumes the determination was done by a specialist; manual.check enables the user to manually check all ambiguos names. Defaut is not.spec.
institution.source

Column name of occ with the name of the institution that provided the data.
collection.code

Column name of occ with the codes for institution names.
catalog.number

Column name of occ with catalog number.
year.event

Column name of occ the year of the collection event.
date.identified

Column name of occ with the date of species determination.
scientific.name

Column name of occ with the species names.
determined.by

Column name of occ with the name of who determined the species.
longitude

Column name of occ longitude in decimal degrees.
latitude

Column name of occ latitude in decimal degrees.
basis.of.rec

Column name of occ with the recording types, as in GBIF.
media.type

Column name of occ with the media type of recording.
occ.id

Column name of occ with link or code for the occurence record.

Value

The occ data frame plus the classification of each record in a new column, named naturaList_levels.

Details

spec data frame must have columns separating LastName, Name and Abbrev. See create_spec_df function for a easy way to produce this data frame.

When ignore.det.name = NULL (default), the function ignores strings with only "RRC ID Flag", "NA", "", "-" and "_". When a character vector is provided, the function adds the strings in character vector to the default strings and ignore all these strings as being a name of a taxonomist.

basis.of.rec is a character vector with one of the following types of record:PRESERVED_SPECIMEN or HUMAN_OBSERVATION, as in GBIF data 'basisOfRecord'.

media.type uses the same pattern as GBIF mediaType column, indicating the existence of an associated image with STILLIMAGE.

See also

speciaLists

Author

Arthur V. Rodrigues

Examples

occ.class <- classify_occ(A.setosa, speciaLists)
